page.title: 13FULWOOD BARRACKS,PRESTON
page.content: This is the home of the Queens Lancashire Regiment of the armed forces. There are about 100 soldiers, stationed here and they stop for between two and three years. Most live in the married quarters but they join in the life of the local community and the children go to local schools. As a peace-time garrison the soldiers do not fight but organise supplies and whatever may be needed in an emergency e.g. a strike. In such an event Fulwood Barracks would look after the West of England from Carlisle to South Wales. There is a museum with weapons and uniforms from the Crimean and Boer Wars. There are modern weapons captured during the recent Falklands conflict, the uniform of an Argentine soldier and a collection of assorted medals.
